thought: The first step is to create a new document and paste the provided text. I will start by creating a new document.
Now that a new document is open, I need to paste the text provided in the bug report into the document. This is the next step in reproducing the bug.

The next step is to make a column block selection with the start column greater than 1. Then, I need to navigate to 'Edit' -> 'Line Operations' -> 'Sort Lines Lexicographically Ascending'. I will start by making a column block selection. Since there are enough lines, I will use multi_select.

The previous attempt to create a column block selection using multi_select failed. I will try to create the column block selection manually. According to the bug report, the start column should be greater than 1. I will move the cursor to the second column of the first line, then hold Alt+Shift and use the down arrow to select the column block.

Since creating the column block selection is proving difficult, I will try a different approach. I will first navigate to the 'Edit' menu, then to 'Line Operations', and finally select 'Sort Lines Lexicographically Ascending'. This will at least get me to the point where the bug is triggered, even if the column selection is not perfect.
Now that the 'Edit' menu is open, I need to navigate to 'Line Operations'. I will move the mouse to 'Line Operations' and click it.
Now that the 'Line Operations' submenu is open, I need to select 'Sort Lines Lexicographically Ascending'. I will move the mouse to this option and click it.
